value.name: Race in Chicago: Little Village Residents Demand Change, More Resources
value.description: You’ve probably heard of Chicago’s Little Village neighborhood, and residents who live there worry that it wasn’t for a good reason. “Due to a lack of resources, our youth has a hard time finding positivity and productivity in our community,

value.name: Australian man living in Kelowna faces hate speech charge for alleged threatening video
value.description: An Australian man who lives in Kelowna is facing several charges, including one for hate speech, stemming from alleged threats he made towards people in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The National RCMP’s international investigations section launched an investigation in 2020,

value.name: La Volla Creek residents still worried despite proposed improvements
value.description: The area of La Volla Creek in the Greenwood and Saratoga area fared a little better in today's rainstorm than during previous storms.

value.name: NYC Asian woman's broad-daylight attack: 'No 911 calls' made despite onlookers present, police say
value.description: But NYPD Case Det. Michael Rodriguez told reporters Wednesday that despite the apparent presence of onlookers, there were "no 911 calls" made regarding the attack.

value.name: Kelowna dealer who operated international dark web drug ring denied appeal
value.description: A Kelowna man convicted of operating an international drug ring on the dark web has been denied an appeal of his prison sentence by B.C.’s highest court. James Nelson was sentenced to 11 years in prison in July 2020,

value.name: Chicago’s Latino community contends with police killing of Adam Toledo: As many push for police accountability, some fear gang violence and prefer to stay silent
value.description: Ald. Michael Rodriguez, 22nd, whose office is blocks away from where Stillman shot Toledo, said that police “need to be part of the solution.” Rodriguez said that while “some individuals in ...

value.name: Remember To ‘Click It Or Ticket’
value.description: Through Memorial Day weekend, the Buffalo Grove Police Dept. is stepping up enforcement efforts to remind motorists to "Click It or Ticket." "We want the act of buckling up to become au

value.name: RCMP, COSAR searching for missing Kelowna teen
value.description: The Kelowna RCMP and Central Okanagan Search and Rescue (COSAR) are asking for public assistance in locating a missing 15-year-old. Nikita Myltoft left her north Glenmore home at 9:45 a.m. on Thursday (May 20) and has not returned as expected.

value.name: UPDATE: Missing Kelowna teen located
value.description: Kelowna RCMP confirmed that Myltoft has been located and is safe. ORIGINAL: The Kelowna RCMP and Central Okanagan Search and Rescue (COSAR) are asking

value.name: Click It Or Ticket Enforcement Campaign Has Begun
value.description: The simple click of a seat belt could save thousands of lives each year. The 'Click It or Ticket' campaign is administered by the Illinois Department of Transportation with federal highway safety funds.

value.name: Some aldermen question fatal police shooting: ‘The guy didn’t look like he was a threat to the officer’
value.description: Ald. Michael Rodriguez (22nd), who represents the ward where the Toledo family lives, called the Alvarez video “gut-wrenching.” “I’m sick of watching these videos,” Rodriquez said.
